article.headline: McNeese St. 89, Louisiana College 60
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. (AP) -- Jarvis Bradley scored 18 points and four others joined him in double figures as McNeese State defeated Louisiana College 89-60 on Saturday. The Cowboys (1-3) came out hot, scoring the first eight points in the game that marked their home debut. McNeese shot 59 percent from the field, including 52.9 percent from 3-point range, on the game compared to 39.3 percent shooting for Louisiana College (0-1). McNeese State led 43-28 at the half. Louisiana College's Morey Skluzacek led all scorers with 25 points. He scored 19 of the Wildcats' first 21 points in the game. Also in double figures for the Wildcats was Josh Johnson, who scored 18. Troy Aaron scored 15 for McNeese, while John Pichon knocked down 12 and both John Ford and Charles Saulnier tallied 10. McNeese held a 37-24 lead in rebounds with Pichon and Aldryan Wardell getting six each. Skluzacek led the game with seven rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
